description: An alteration of brinded, probably by association with speckled, grizzled etc.

adjectives.description: brindled (comparative more brindled, superlative most brindled)

entries.meaning: of a brownish, tawny or gray colour, with streaks or spots; streaky, spotted
examples: And there, in the middle of it was the man himselfâ€”his face twisted like a lost soul in torment, and his great brindled beard stuck upwards in his agony.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of brindle
